text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale, and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I want to share with

you, my really quick, yet delightful and addictive,
Old Bay, Cherry Peppers, Fried Calamari.
That's all I gotta say!
They are positively delightful.
Crispy, spicy, delicious and easy.

It requires, one - two - three - four - five
ingredients.

Starting with some calamari rings, of course.
Now I have a little calamari rings - and I

did - I'll explain this to you in a minute,
just chopped them myself into little rings,
you can but them already chopped like that.

Now what I have here are some pickled sliced
cherry peppers.

These are one of my favorite standby foods
because they are delicious on pretty much

anything, and they give you a really spicy
hot kick. I love them, it's making my mouth,
like, water.

What I've done, and what you need to do is,
once you get them - especially the calamari

cut and all that, you want to rinse them and
put them on a paper towel and then you take

another piece of paper towel and you pat them
dry really really well.

You want the cherry peppers and the calamari
really, really dry so that it won't splatter
in the oil.

And I've got some vegetable oil here preheating,
I want this to get nice and hot and don't

worry if there's little bits of things in
there, I was frying something else earlier,
so I'm going to use the same oil.

So I've got that coming up to a really nice
high temperature, and now I'm going to need

some all purpose flour and then I've got some
Old Bay seasoning here.

Old bay is my favorite seafood seasoning,
but you can use any seafood seasoning you

like, this just the one that we get here in
the states that we just love and it's wonderful.

And you don't even need any salt and pepper
for this recipe because there is plenty of

salt and pepper in here so it's just going
to flavor this beautifully.

To my all purpose flour, I am going to add
the calamari and my little cherry peppers.

I'm going to fry up my cherry peppers so they
get really nice and crispy.

The idea for this came a long time ago, about
five years ago, my husband and I were in Boston,

right after we got married we took a trip
to Boston and we went to a fabulous seafood

place. And of course, I'm a fried calamari
lover, so I ordered some fried calamari thinking

it was just going to come the standard way,
you know, plain old fried calamari, which
I love!

But this was just spiced up with Old Bay and
had these spicy fried cherry peppers running
through it that pretty much blew my mind.

So of course I had to recreate it, I've been
doing it ever since, and we just love it around
here!

I don't make these often because it really
is something you won't stop eating.
That's the truth!

So anyway, I am taking a few of my calamari
and my cherry peppers, and I do this in batches.

And I've got some vegetable oil getting nice
and hot in my pan - and don't worry if it

looks like there's stuff in there, I was frying
something earlier that I didn't want to waste

the oil so I'm going to do it in the same
oil.

I'm going to drop those in, and I'm going
to do this a little bit at a time because

I don't want to drop the temperature of the
oil. So, I'm going to just cook these for

a couple minutes, not even, it'll take no
time at all, or until they get a beautiful
golden brown color, then get really crispy.

I'm going to put them on a paper towel lined
plate, and I'll show you what I do when they're
all done.
Oh, these are really nice and crispy!

Putting them right on the plate that I've
lined with paper towels.
Smells really, really good in here!

Those cherry peppers are like calling my name.
I'm actually going to turn this off because
all mine are done!

And they literally take like a minute per
batch, they take no time at all, especially

because these are so little, they cook in
no time.

So now, I take some Old Bay, Ah! I love Old
Bay!
Sprinkle that over the top.

You can do as much or as little as you want.
And then you just - you hear the crunch? Do
you hear them?
Ah!
That's gorgeous!

I'll put a little bit more, because I love
Old Bay, I love Old Bay Fries, can't go wrong
with that!
[Crunch!]
Mmm.
Mmm!
Mmm!
Hot!
Really hot, but phenomenal!

I'm going to eat this pepper right here, oh
this looks even better!

Super easy to make, super good, very addictive,
you don't even have to leave the scene of
the crime to enjoy them.

Go to LauraintheKitchen.com to get the full
written recipe. Let me know down below what

some of your favorite versions and variations
of fried calamari are and if you want me to
recreate it.

Hope you have enjoyed spending time with me
and I'll see you next time!
Bye bye!
